intro: Coelidium cedarbergensis, commonly known as the Cedarberg coelidium, is a unique plant native to the Cedarberg region of South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many species of grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, wiry foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
